channel.title: Festivals this summer and the bands
channel.description:
Which ones are you attending? I'm going to Sweden Rock Festival, Wacken Open Air and Muskelrock. Here's the complete list of bands:
Sweden Rock Festival:
Heaven & Hell, Motörhead, ZZ Top, In Flames, Dream Theater, Journey, Foreigner, Flogging Molly, Europe, Uriah Heep, Twisted Sister, HammerFall, Sevendust, Marillion, Amon Amarth, Kamelot, Soilwork, Pain, UFO, Johnny Winter, Immortal, Deathstars, Rage, Volbeat, Candlemass, Lita Ford, Voivod, Neal Morse, Unleashed, Torch, Tank, Witchcraft, The Outlaws, Amberian Dawn, The Tubes, Blackfoot, Riot, Deströyer 666, Forbidden, Eric Sardinas, Grand Magus, Vains of Jenna, Demon, Lujuria, Helstar, Impellitteri, Bullet, Crucified Barbara, Babylon Bombs, Abramis Brama, Seventh Wonder, Jon Oliva's Pain, Electric Boys, Renegade Five, Tyketto, Thor, Enforcer, Hot Leg, Kebnekajse, Blaze Bayley, Dan Baird, Demonical, Pilgrimz, Tim "Ripper" Owens, H.E.A.T., Over The Rainbow, Black Tooth, Hysterica, Chains, Stormzone, Ground Mower, The Chair, Innocent Rosie, Fourever, Powderhog, Tracenine, Hindenburg and Axident Avenue
Wacken Open Air:
Motörhead, In Flames, Bullet For My Valentine, Coheed and Cambria, Lacuna Coil, Thin Lizzy, DragonForce, Machine Head, Anthrax, HammerFall, Amon Amarth, Epica, Testament, Tristania, Saxon, Gamma Ray, Pain, Nevermore, Korpiklaani, UFO, In Extremo, Bring Me the Horizon, Napalm Death, Heaven Shall Burn, Running Wild, Rage, Turisas, Subway to Sally, Walls of Jericho, Volbeat, Mägo de Oz, Borknagar, Airbourne, Enslaved, Schandmaul, GWAR, Axel Rudi Pell, Doro, ASP, UK Subs, Cathedral, Einherjer, Pentagram, Warlock, D-A-D, The BossHoss, Kampfar, Whiplash, Grand Magus, Trouble, Rabenschrey, Heaven & Hell, Onkel Tom Angelripper, Endstille, Eths, Vreid, Tracedawn, Engel, Der W, Drone, Callejón, Mambo Kurt, Retrospect, Torment, Feuerschwanz, The Waltons, Nervecell, SARKE, Bon Scott, Bloodwork, Bai Bang, The Fading, 5th Avenue, Victims of Madness and Insidious Disease
Muskelrock:
Wolf, Torch, Witchcraft, Portrait, Bullet, Ram, Backdraft, Abramis Brama, Graveyard, Thor, Enforcer, Count Raven, The Devil's Blood, Eviscerated, Scams, Solid Ground, Cauldron, Spice And The RJ Band, In Solitude, Axewitch and Helvetets Port
Lots of shitty hardcore emo-bands but also lots of great bands such as Abramis Brama, Thor, Enforcer, Thin Lizzy, Onkel Tom Angelripper, Testament, Whiplash, Running Wild, Rage etc etc

item.title: Festivals this summer and the bands
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“jensie, post:30, topic:280146”]How would you fill 3 days of festival with only ‘original’ metalbands?[/quote]Keep it true manages to do it twice a year, same with headbangers open air

Read full topic

How would you fill 3 days of festival with only ‘original’ metalbands?

item.title: Festivals this summer and the bands
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“jensie, post:28, topic:280146”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=369728.msg2837414#msg2837414 date=1245766117]

[quote author=jensie link=topic=369728.msg2837323#msg2837323 date=1245760351]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=369728.msg2837288#msg2837288 date=1245757534]

[quote author=jensie link=topic=369728.msg2836840#msg2836840 date=1245721187]

Fuck you, go die
I can’t make it to graspop this year due to the fucking test week, which I’ve got to study for a lot cuz otherwise I’d fail.
Also, Roadburn sold out in like 45 minutes so I was unable to get tickets.
The other festivals are pretty much too far away >_<

I’ll see if ProgPower is any good this year, I believe it’s somewhere in October
[/quote]Try Pukkelpop? Also in Belgium.
I’m going to Rock Werchter… Grazy line-up:

They’ve both got a shitty lineup.

Depends on what you would like to see…
Belgium has got anything really!
[/quote]If you want to see metal there’s only really a few good choices. Keep It True, Headbangers Open Air, Metal Merchant’s festival and a few others.

Graspop, Wacken, Download…
[/quote]All of those festivals has tons of emo-bands and only a few good bands.

Oh sure… Trivium, W.A.S.P, Ufo, Disturbed, Sick of it all, Heaven and hell, Hatebreed, Killswitch Engage, …
Those are all emo-band…
Nice try
[/quote]Actually the only non-shitty bands you mentioned were WASP, UFO and Heaven and Hell ^^

In your opinion…[/quote]Nu-Metal isn’t metal and neither is hardcore. Hardcore bands should get their own festivals and leave the metal-scene alone

Read full topic
item.source: Festivals this summer and the bands

item.title: Festivals this summer and the bands
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:16, topic:280146”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=369728.msg2827676#msg2827676 date=1245146893]

[quote author=T4_ link=topic=369728.msg2826945#msg2826945 date=1245094882]

Sweden Rock Festival:
In Flames, Dream Theater, Amon Amarth, Volbeat

Wacken Open Air:
Machine Head, Anthrax, Amon Amarth, Testament, Bring Me the Horizon, Napalm Death, Volbeat

At least they have some good taste.
[/quote]Shame the only good bands you mentioned were Anthrax, Testament, Napalm Death and Dream Theater.
[/quote]In Flames is decent. As for the rest, i agree.[/quote]
I just picked out the ones I knew of that related to the metal genre. Doesn’t mean I like them all. I like Anthrax, Testament, Napalm Death, and In Flames the best out of that list.

Read full topic

wacken looks sick. sweden rock looks decent too.

Have fun man!

SHIT! The graspop lineup this year is SICK! Why can I never have money
[/quote]
Only band that interests me this year is Pestilence. Ah well, last year I went to graspop mainly to see Alchemist lool, so it wouldn’t matter if there wasn’t a lot of crappy bands.
Also the headliners suck ass.[/quote]Yah, Graspop has had great line-ups the last few years but this year is a fucking disgrace (if you count Pestilence away ofc)
